column1: Chassis Antie will be implemented on a tiny Road Warrior robotic system. [SEP] Behaviors will be coded in Interactive C, for which some pseudocode is included. [SEP] Sensors will include a thermometer, photoreceptors, bump sensors, a polarization compass, and a series of chemical receptors. [SEP] Antie be a circular robot, no more than 1cm in diameter (the length of a red harvester ant), with two
column3: wheels and one rear wheel for stabilization. [SEP] A gripper will be located on the front of the robot consisting of two elongated tongs. [SEP] Antie will also feature a skirt of bump sensors, sonar detectors and chemical emitters, including sacs of hydrocarbons extracted from ants of the nest being infiltrated and pheromones for successful patrolling and foraging. [SEP] These sacs will be refilled at a filling station each morning as Antie determines that they are getting depleted. [SEP] Antie will likewise recharge at a special station at night just inside the nest entrance. [SEP] For the purposes of this proposal, I will assume that Antie has enough battery life to remain powered the whole day. [SEP] A rudimentary blueprint of Antie is attached. column1: He falls exhausted to the ground and the sound of the snow crunching beneath his body fills his frozen ears. [SEP] He gasps as the cold seeps through his clothes. [SEP] He can’t stop his teeth from chattering hopelessly and his shoulders begin to shake as well. [SEP] “Oooooo,” he groans, shifting on the cold ground. [SEP] “Noooo...” [SEP] His attempted moan escapes as only a whisper. [SEP] He can hear the sound of nearby cars
column3: by and he lifts an arm uselessly. [SEP] ”...Help! [SEP] ” he croaks quietly. [SEP] His leg aches terribly. [SEP] It feels as though a knife is piercing through his skin and his muscles and—oh! [SEP] The pain is unbearable! [SEP] His ears are ringing.

column1: “I know your family. Get in. We have a lot of work ahead of us, and it’s best to start now.” [SEP] I walked around the car and got into the passenger seat. [SEP] Before I had my belt on, we were rolling forward. [SEP] “Okay,” I said. [SEP] “I’m in the car. Now, will you tell me how you know my family, and how you happened to be
column3: by just now? In fact, why didn’t you call me by name the first time? And how did you recognize me when – ” “That’s enough! I can only answer one question at a time. I know your family because an ancestor of mine made a bargain with an ancestor of yours. I am here now because you called for help, and no-one else would answer.” [SEP] He turned onto the next street and shifted up. [SEP] “I will help you find your Rachel. I have to warn you, though, you won’t like what I have to tell you.”
